subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: You re right again, I misread the specification. :( If we re going to include the use of Variant Selectors in our proposal they re going to have to have well
messageBody:
You're right again, I misread the specification. :(
If we're going to include the use of Variant Selectors in our proposal
they're going to have to have well defined behaviour.

My thinking was that VS1 would be the glyph as used on the 'The
Quikscript Alphabet' and the glyph which would be used in 'dumb' or
Junior fonts.
VS2 would be the alternate form (as far as I can see each character has
zero or one alternate forms), i.e. half-height or with different join
points.

Can you see any issues with this?

John Cowan wrote:
>
> amd64_hacker scripsit:
>
> > For example Quikscript Letter No followed by Variant Selector 1 would be
> > the 'normal' glyph with the join points at the top.
> > Quikscript Letter No followed by Variant Selector 2 would select the
> > 'alternate' glyph with the joins at the bottom.
>
> Ah. Quite so.
>
> > This isn't something I'd recommend for day to day use and it certainly
> > shouldn't be part of the proposal.
>
> Actually it must; uses of variant selectors should be blessed by UTC.
>
> --
> In politics, obedience and support John Cowan <cowan@...
> <mailto:cowan%40ccil.org>>
> are the same thing. --Hannah Arendt http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
> <http://www.ccil.org/%7Ecowan>
>
>
